data.text: @SheroNo1 @Takeastepback16 @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK Children still catch and spread it, and it can mutate in children.  If you do not vaccinate them, they can still get very ill and die, and continue to spread it.
@SheroNo1 @Takeastepback16 @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK No, those in Norway were not linked to the vaccine.  And the US ones are reported after the vaccine, not linked.

@SheroNo1 @SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK People die all the time - usually they are on medication or had a vaccine in the past. The VAERS system allows regulators to look into all cases and see if any problems are linked or not linked. The '29' deaths in Norway have not been linked to the vaccine.https://t.co/1ev1vTqTtU

@SheroNo1 @SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK I agree children don't need to vaccinated unless they have specific medical need. Vaccine safety issues occur early on - things don't suddenly  occur years later.

@SheroNo1 @SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK If you have a specific allergy to any of the ingredients of the vaccine (this is true of any vaccine), you should not have it. As there are different Covid vaccines now, you should be able to find one that is OK for you. https://t.co/qYR5tWMzt6

@SheroNo1 @SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK However, efficacy in specific age groups, length of protection afforded, effects on transmission, combination of vaccines, dosing timings, variant effects etc still need further understanding and so studies will continue. But this does not mean the vaccines are experimental.

@SheroNo1 @SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK My view, is we have enough safety data to say Covid vaccines are safe. We also have enough efficacy data to say that they provide good levels of protection and are worth having. They are not experimental anymore.

@SheroNo1 @SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK Second type of data is efficacy. Usually, you test 'does it work' in a specific group of people. If it works, you then test it further in wider groups of people to see effects of age, sex, comorbidities, genetic background etc etc etc.

@SheroNo1 @SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK First type of clinical data you get is safety. It is assessed from first dose and you never stop accumulating it *ever* for any medicine through the VAERS/yellow card systems all countries have. We have120M doses worth of this info now - vaccines are safe.
@Takeastepback16 @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK Especially ones who deliberately ignore the science...

@FlimsyBox @SwaledaleMutton @Dendog_UK Lots of trials underway on lots of different medicines but it does just take time to get a clear answer. But when a small group of docs push one treatment so heavily when consensus opinion is 'no clear positive evidence', it is concerning. Beware doctors with a God complex.

@FlimsyBox @SwaledaleMutton @Dendog_UK Recovery and Project Warp Speed to name but two had made money available to do clinical trials on anything that committees of experts think could work. This is why Dexamthasone was tested and then proved to show benefit.
@FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK @Takeastepback16 They do disagree, but one of them told me that they ignore all of the science, and just go with what they think.  That is no way to treat patients.

@FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK @Takeastepback16 Well, there are other trials ongoing, but the main problem is that the dose you would need would be so high, it would be almost toxic.  And if there are significant side effects and marginal possible benefits...

@SheroNo1 @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK @Takeastepback16 No, you are mixing things up here.  Germany thinks the Oxford vaccine is not effective against over 65's (it is).
There are no adverse effects.

@SheroNo1 @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK @Takeastepback16 For the Pfizer vaccine, Serious Events are at about 1 in 100,000, and no deaths at all out of many millions of vaccinations given.
The SAA's that have been seen have all been resolved with no lasting effects.

@SheroNo1 @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK @Takeastepback16 No, they are not experimental.  They have been in development as a technology for 30+ years, have been used in people before and were tested as normal.

And I would not trust that link at all.  The official figures have not, as far as I am aware, linked any deaths at all.

@SwaledaleMutton @FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK @Takeastepback16 The Manufacturers standing to earn *$$$$* have this to say - compare to when the manufacturers of HCQ RUSHED to donate millions of doses and immediately set up confirmatory trials https://t.co/FzDQQ2ChdZ
@FlimsyBox @Dendog_UK @Takeastepback16 Only 11 are clinical and those were very small and statistically insignificant.
@Takeastepback16 The same people wanting ivermectin used with little or no trial?
